comment: Very patient man, but his grading was SUPER detailed. I love to write, but dreaded his papers because of his grading. His tests are tedious. Quizzes are easy. Can be very passive aggressive. VERY unclear directions/ due dates. I wanted to love this class but it is the least enjoyable for me :/
Dr. Lee is a kind compassionate man, and has infinite patience! His tests were straight from his quizzes and guided notes. Requires that you write a few papers. I enjoyed the class!

His English isn't the best but he tries. Lecture can be a little droning but he tries to clarify anything if you can't understand him. He can be a tough grader when it comes to assignments. He is a nice professor. Willing to help if you need it. Quizzes before each class are easy and really help for clarity, on tests, and overall grade.

If you are passionate about Special Education, do not take him. He does not speak clear English, and his "knowledge" on the content comes directly from the textbook and his PowerPoints. Should not be a Professor at KSU; especially not teaching such an important course.
